titles.title: North American Wetlands Conservation Council Expansion Act of 1999
North American Wetlands Conservation Council Expansion Act of 1999
To amend the North American Wetlands Conservation Act to provide for appointment of 2 additional members of the North American Wetlands Conservation Council.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries Conservation, Wildlife and Oceans.
Subcommittee on Fisheries Conservation, Wildlife and Oceans Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-388.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 224.

action.text: Mr. Doolittle moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2821.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

bill.summary: 10/18/1999--Passed House amended. North American Wetlands Conservation Council Expansion Act of 1999 - Amends the North American Wetlands Conservation Act to increase from: (1) nine to eleven the total membership of the North American Wetlands Conservation Council; and (2) three to five the number of nongovernmental members of the Council. Provides initial term periods for the two new members.
